subject: Law
title: Free Speech on Social Media
description: A short lesson to help you apply Free Speech on Social Media.

hook.text: A social media platform bans a politician. Is that censorship or a private company's right? The law says it depends.

buildup.text: The First Amendment only restricts government censorship. Private companies can set their own content rules.

discovery.text: Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act protects platforms from liability for user-generated content.

twist.text: Some argue platforms are now so dominant they function like public squares and should face speech obligations.

climax.text: Courts are split. Several states have passed laws banning platform content moderation. Legal battles continue.

punchline.text: The First Amendment hasn't caught up to the internet yet.

quiz.question: Does the First Amendment restrict what private social media companies can remove?
